title: 108_s2173
content:
The Act is titled the "Sand Creek Massacre National Historic Site Trust Act of 2004" and includes definitions. The Act defines key terms such as "Secretary" as the Secretary of the Interior, "facility" as any structure on trust property, and "improvement" as specific structures and systems on the property. The term "Tribe" refers to the Cheyenne and Arapaho Tribes of Oklahoma, a federally recognized Indian tribe. Trust property, known as the "Dawson Ranch," consists of approximately 1,465 acres in Kiowa County, Colorado, under the Tribe's jurisdiction. The Dawson Ranch, approximately 1,465 acres in Kiowa County, Colorado, falls under the jurisdiction of the Cheyenne and Arapaho Tribes of Oklahoma. This includes all of section 30, Township 17 South, Range 45 West, sixth principal meridian. Upon conveyance of title to the trust property by the Tribe to the United States, the land shall be held in trust for the Cheyenne and Arapaho Tribes of Oklahoma. All right, title, and interest of the United States in the trust property are declared to be held in trust for the Tribe, except for facilities constructed under section 4(b). The Secretary may acquire improvements in fee by donation. Facilities can be constructed on trust property after consulting with and obtaining agreement from the Tribes. Facilities built with Federal funds will be owned by the United States. Federal funds can only be used on facilities owned by the United States. Additionally, there will be a survey of the boundary line and publication of its description. SEC. 5. SURVEY OF BOUNDARY LINE; PUBLICATION OF DESCRIPTION.

To establish the trust property boundary accurately, the Secretary will conduct a survey within 180 days. Once the survey is completed and accepted by the Tribe, the full description of the trust property will be published in the Federal Register, becoming the official description.

SEC. 6. ADMINISTRATION OF TRUST PROPERTY. The trust property at the Sand Creek Massacre National Historic Site is to be administered by the Secretary in perpetuity for historical, traditional, and cultural uses. The Secretary has access to the property for management purposes and must ensure it is used in accordance with the law. The laws and policies governing units of the National Park System are not superseded by this Act. SEC. 7. ACQUISITION OF PROPERTY. Amends the Sand Creek Massacre National Historic Site Establishment Act to allow acquisition of property by exchange in addition to donation.
